greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that Phi(n,k), the n-th cyclotomic polynomial evaluated at k, is prime.
comment: Note that a(n)=1 iff n is a power of a prime.
Because every cyclotomic polynomial is irreducible, it is expected that a(n) exists for all n.
Note that if p=Phi(n,k) is prime and n>1, then p==1 (mod k). - Corrected by _Robert Israel_, Apr 22 2019
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
maple: f:= proc(n) local C, x, k;
for k from 1 do if isprime(C(k)) then return k fi od
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(k=1); while (!isprime(polcyclo(n, k)), k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 22 2019
xref: Cf. A117545 (least k such that Phi(k, n) is prime).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Mar 28 2006
